info.author: Martin Aspeli
classifiers: Topic :: Software Development :: Libraries :: Python Modules
info.description:
Introduction
============

This package provides a new portlet, the "True review list", and an associated
view, @@true_review_list.

Unlike the regular review list portlet and view, it takes the "Review portal
content" permission into account, via a custom indexer for a catalog index
called 'reviewerRolesAndUsers'. Thus, it will only show content for which
the current user has this permission. The portlet can also be limited to only
show certain workflow states (defaulting to 'pending') and types.

Note that it does not use worklists directly, so if you are relying on custom
per-workflow worklists, you should still use the default portlet.

Installation requires Plone 3.3. You will not need to install a ZCML slug -
just add it to your buildout's 'eggs' list or as a new requirement in the
setup.py of your product.

Changelog
=========

1.0b1 (2009-03-31)
------------------

* Initial release
info.name: collective.portlet.truereview
info.summary: A review portlet that takes review permissions into account
info.html_description:
Introduction

This package provides a new portlet, the “True review list”, and an associated view, @@true_review_list.

Unlike the regular review list portlet and view, it takes the “Review portal content” permission into account, via a custom indexer for a catalog index called ‘reviewerRolesAndUsers’. Thus, it will only show content for which the current user has this permission. The portlet can also be limited to only show certain workflow states (defaulting to ‘pending’) and types.

Note that it does not use worklists directly, so if you are relying on custom per-workflow worklists, you should still use the default portlet.

Installation requires Plone 3.3. You will not need to install a ZCML slug - just add it to your buildout’s ‘eggs’ list or as a new requirement in the setup.py of your product.

Changelog

1.0b1 (2009-03-31)

  • Initial release
